defs.name: without_fonts
defs.docs: Create a new builder without any fonts.

attributes.value: / Create a new builder without any fonts.
/ **Warning:** A [`GlyphBrush`] built without fonts will panic if you try to use it as it
/ will have no default `FontId(0)` to use.
/ Use [`GlyphBrush.add_font`] before queueing any text sections in order to avoid panicking.

defs.name: gpu_cache_align_4x4
defs.docs: Align glyphs in texture cache to 4x4 texel boundaries.

attributes.value: / Align glyphs in texture cache to 4x4 texel boundaries.
/ If your backend requires texture updates to be aligned to 4x4 texel
/ boundaries (e.g. WebGL), this should be set to `true`.

defs.name: cache_glyph_positioning
defs.docs:
Sets whether perform the calculation of glyph positioning according to the layout
 every time, or use a cached result if the input `Section` and `GlyphPositioner` are the
 same hash as a previous call.

attributes.value: / Sets whether perform the calculation of glyph positioning according to the layout
/ every time, or use a cached result if the input `Section` and `GlyphPositioner` are the
/ same hash as a previous call.
/ Improves performance. Should only disable if using a custom GlyphPositioner that is
/ impure according to it's inputs, so caching a previous call is not desired. Disabling

defs.name: GlyphBrush
defs.docs:
Object allowing glyph drawing, containing cache state. Manages glyph positioning cacheing,
 glyph draw caching & efficient GPU texture cache updating.

attributes.value: / Object allowing glyph drawing, containing cache state. Manages glyph positioning cacheing,
/ glyph draw caching & efficient GPU texture cache updating.
/ Also see [`GlyphCruncher`](trait.GlyphCruncher.html) trait which providers extra functionality,
/ calculate the positioned glyphs for a section.
/ This is cached so future calls to any of the methods for the same section are much
/ cheaper. In the case of [`GlyphBrush::queue`](#method.queue) the calculations will also be
/ The cache for a section will be **cleared** after a
/ [`GlyphBrush::process_queued`](#method.process_queued) call when that section has not been used
/ Note the gpu/draw cache may contain multiple versions of the same glyph at different
/ This is required for high quality text as a glyph's positioning is always exactly aligned
/ This behaviour can be adjusted with

defs.name: process_queued
defs.value:
pub fn process_queued<F1, F2>(&mut Self, F1, F2)
-> Result<BrushAction<V>, BrushError> where F1: FnMut(Rect<u32>, &[u8]) -> (),
F2: Fn(GlyphVertex) -> V + Copy
defs.docs:
Processes all queued sections, calling texture update logic when necessary &
 returning a `BrushAction`.
 See [`queue`](struct.GlyphBrush.html#method.queue).

attributes.value: / Processes all queued sections, calling texture update logic when necessary &
/ * `update_texture` is called when new glyph texture data has been drawn for update in the
/   The arguments are the rect position of the data in the texture & the byte data itself
/   which is a single `u8` alpha value per pixel.
/ * `to_vertex` maps a single glyph's `GlyphVertex` data into a generic vertex type. The
/   mapped vertices are returned in an `Ok(BrushAction::Draw(vertices))` result.
/   It's recommended to use a single vertex per glyph quad for best performance.

defs.name: pixel_bounds_custom_layout
defs.value:
pub fn pixel_bounds_custom_layout<'a, S, L>(&mut Self, S, &L)
-> Option<Rect<i32>> where L: GlyphPositioner + Hash, S: Into<Cow>
defs.docs:
Returns the pixel bounding box for the input section using a custom layout.
 The box is a conservative whole number pixel rectangle that can contain the section.

attributes.value: / Returns the pixel bounding box for the input section using a custom layout.
/ The box is a conservative whole number pixel rectangle that can contain the section.
/ If the section is empty or would result in no drawn glyphs will return `None`.
/ bounds are to be used to inform further layout logic.

defs.docs:
Returns the pixel bounding box for the input section. The box is a conservative
 whole number pixel rectangle that can contain the section.

attributes.value: / Returns the pixel bounding box for the input section. The box is a conservative
/ whole number pixel rectangle that can contain the section.
/ If the section is empty or would result in no drawn glyphs will return `None`.
/ [`glyph_bounds`](#method.glyph_bounds) should be preferred if the bounds are to be
/ used to inform further layout logic.

defs.name: GlyphCalculator
defs.docs:
Cut down version of a [`GlyphBrush`](struct.GlyphBrush.html) that can calculate pixel bounds,
 but is unable to actually render anything.

attributes.value: / Cut down version of a [`GlyphBrush`](struct.GlyphBrush.html) that can calculate pixel bounds,
/ but is unable to actually render anything.
/ // create the scope, equivalent to a lock on the cache when
/ // dropped will clean unused cached calculations like a draw call
/ [`GlyphCalculatorGuard::glyphs`](#method.glyphs) calculate the positioned glyphs for a
/ section. This is cached so future calls to any of the methods for the same section are much
/ Unlike a [`GlyphBrush`](struct.GlyphBrush.html) there is no concept of actually drawing
/ the section to imply when a section is used / no longer used. Instead a `GlyphCalculatorGuard`
/ is created, that provides the calculation functionality. Dropping indicates the 'cache frame'
/ is over, similar to when a `GlyphBrush` draws. Section calculations are cached for the next
/ 'cache frame', if not used then they will be dropped.
